instNote: This church was accidentally destroyed by fire during the war, while used as quarters for Confederate soldiers. It has not been rebuilt as yet, for want of means. The number of Catholics residing here is small, but numbers congregate here in the summer months, because of the famous healing baths of the Berkeley Springs.

This church was destroyed during the war, chiefly by Federal soldiers, who stabled their horses in it. It has not been rebuilt yet, for want of resources. There are here about 200 Catholics, but generally without means. A new church has been commenced.
